properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 8:46PM PST until January 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...SNOW IN THE CASCADES TONIGHT FOLLOWED BY POTENTIAL HEAVY SNOW NORTHERN
VALLEYS AND MOUNTAINS LATE WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY MORNING...

.A weather system will pass through the Cascades tonight bringing snow
especially to areas near the Cascade crest. Cold wind chills as
low as 15 degrees below zero will continue down the Okanogan
Valley. A stronger storm arrives late Wednesday with snow
beginning early afternoon in the Cascades before spreading east
into the late afternoon and evening.

* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind
chills as low as 15 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch,
heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches
possible.

* WHERE...Omak, Okanogan, Brewster, Bridgeport, Oroville,
Nespelem, and Disautel Pass.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM PST Wednesday.
For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through
Thursday morning.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if
precautions are not taken. Travel could be very difficult late
Wednesday afternoon into Thursday morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow may develop as early as
Wednesday afternoon increasing in intensity in the evening.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING
